oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Subquadratic Algorithms for Succinct Stable Matching
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Moeller, Daniel
Paturi, Ramamohan
Schneider, Stefan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Computer Science - Data Structures and Algorithms
Computer Science - Computational Complexity
Computer Science - Computer Science and Game Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider the stable matching problem when the preference lists are not given explicitly but are represented in a succinct way and ask whether the problem becomes computationally easier. We give subquadratic algorithms for finding a stable matching in special cases of two very natural succinct representations of the problem, the $d$-attribute and $d$-list models. We also give algorithms for verifying a stable matching in the same models. We further show that for $d = \omega(\log n)$ both finding and verifying a stable matching in the $d$-attribute model requires quadratic time assuming the Strong Exponential Time Hypothesis. The $d$-attribute model is therefore as hard as the general case for large enough values of $d$.
